translations.english_saheeh: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Has there come to you the narration of the overwhelming (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)?
translations.english_rwwad: Has there come to you the story of the Overwhelming Event?

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.88:2) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism), but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim , the Book of Faith, Vol.1, Chapter No.240). See also the footnotes of (V.3:85) and (V.41:46).

translations.english_saheeh: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Some faces, that Day will be humiliated (in the Hell-fire, i.e. the faces of all disbelievers, Jews and Christians).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day, some faces will be humiliated,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1910]- Another accepted meaning is "They were working hard and exhausted," i.e., doing deeds during worldly life which did not benefit them since they were not accompanied by faith or done for the acceptance of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.88:3) Narrated ‘Abdullâh رضي الله عنه: "The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said one statement and I said another. The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Whoever dies while still invoking anything other than Allâh as a rival to Allâh, will enter Hell (Fire).’ And I said, ‘Whoever dies without invoking anything as a rival to Allâh, will enter Paradise.’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadith No.24).

translations.english_saheeh: Working [hard] and exhausted.[1910]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Labouring (hard in the worldly life by worshipping others besides Allâh), weary (in the Hereafter with humility and disgrace).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: toiling and weary,

translations.english_saheeh: They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will enter in the hot blazing Fire.
translations.english_rwwad: as they burn in a scorching Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will be given to drink from a boiling spring,
translations.english_rwwad: They will be made to drink from a boiling spring,

arabic_text: لَّيۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٖ

translations.english_saheeh: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
translations.english_hilali_khan: No food will there be for them but a poisonous thorny plant,
translations.english_rwwad: and they will have no food except bitter thorny plants,

arabic_text: لَّا يُسۡمِنُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِن جُوعٖ
phonetic: 88.7 Lā Yusminu Wa Lā Yughnī Min Jū`in

translations.english_saheeh: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Which will neither nourish nor avail against hunger.
translations.english_rwwad: that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.

translations.english_saheeh: [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Other) faces that Day will be joyful,
translations.english_rwwad: Other faces on that Day will be joyful,

translations.english_saheeh: With their effort [they are] satisfied
translations.english_hilali_khan: Glad with their endeavour (for their good deeds which they did in this world, along with the true Faith of Islâmic Monotheism).[3]
translations.english_rwwad: well-pleased with their past striving,

translations.english_saheeh: In an elevated garden,
translations.english_hilali_khan: In a lofty Paradise.
translations.english_rwwad: in an elevated garden,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1911]- i.e., any insult, falsehood, immorality, idle or vain talk, etc.

translations.english_saheeh: Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.[1911]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Where they shall neither hear harmful speech nor falsehood.
translations.english_rwwad: wherein no idle talk will be heard.

translations.english_saheeh: Within it is a flowing spring.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therein will be a running spring.
translations.english_rwwad: There will be a flowing spring;

translations.english_saheeh: Within it are couches raised high
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therein will be thrones raised high.
translations.english_rwwad: and couches raised high,

translations.english_saheeh: And cups put in place
translations.english_hilali_khan: And cups set at hand.
translations.english_rwwad: and cups placed ready,

translations.english_saheeh: And cushions lined up
translations.english_hilali_khan: And cushions set in rows.
translations.english_rwwad: and cushions lined up,

translations.english_saheeh: And carpets spread around.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And rich carpets (all) spread out.
translations.english_rwwad: and splendid carpets spread out.

arabic_text: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَيۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ

translations.english_saheeh: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do they not look at the camels, how they are created?
translations.english_rwwad: Do they not reflect on the camel, how it is created;

translations.english_saheeh: And at the sky - how it is raised?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And at the heaven, how it is raised?
translations.english_rwwad: and the sky, how it is raised high;

translations.english_saheeh: And at the mountains - how they are erected?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And at the mountains, how they are rooted (and fixed firm)?
translations.english_rwwad: and the mountains, how they are firmly set up;

translations.english_saheeh: And at the earth - how it is spread out?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And at the earth, how it is outspread?
translations.english_rwwad: and the earth, how it is spread out?

translations.english_saheeh: So remind, [O Muḥammad]; you are only a reminder.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So remind them (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) - you are only one who reminds.
translations.english_rwwad: So remind [O Prophet]; your duty is only to remind;

translations.english_saheeh: You are not over them a controller.
translations.english_hilali_khan: You are not a dictator over them -
translations.english_rwwad: you are not assigned to compel them.

translations.english_saheeh: However, he who turns away and disbelieves
translations.english_hilali_khan: Save the one who turns away and disbelieves.[4]
translations.english_rwwad: But whoever turns away and disbelieves,

translations.english_saheeh: Then Allāh will punish him with the greatest punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then Allâh will punish him with the greatest punishment.
translations.english_rwwad: Allah will inflict upon him the greatest punishment.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, to Us is their return.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, to Us will be their return;
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, to Us is their return,

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.
translations.english_rwwad: then it is for Us to call them to account.
